ygData.messageBody:
Glad to hear that the "Downgraded" weapon gets passed down. That's very
rare and almost every situation I've seen is that when you win a lotto it's
your property forever to do with what you want.

Sounds like you are in a great guilds where people work together for the
common good. Your lucky - that's not very common (especially from what I've
seen on Xegony).

My only concern is the number of instances I've seen (and allusions on
Backstage and here) of the mentality that the bard never gets any. I've
heard (first hand) of pickup raids where after the fact it was stated bards
were ineligible for haste item - and universal acceptance of that.

Priority to Warriors for weapons is fine as long as it isn't a perpetuating
thing where Bards NEVER get a chance for a good item.

And once again - maybe it's different for you - but I'm often in groups
where there is only bards and rangers meleeing - given that a Ranger's melee
skill is pretty much equal to a Bards - I'd argue that shows the Bard and
Ranger has as much "Need" as the warrior for the good weapon. One of the
reason I'm meleeing is to keep that Enchanter from getting hit for
example...

Once again - I'm not criticizing Elfson and his guild for what clearly works
for them - just pointing out that IMHO - it's and exception not the rule.
And I've seen too many cases where bards and simply screwed out of things
they can justify a need for as much as anyone else.

-----Original Message-----
From: Matt DeBarger [mailto:mattdeba@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 08, 2001 1:19 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Guild Loot Rules


I said in my example that when the warrior got the crscent blade, I was
given his lammy, Of course we discovered I can't wield it, so it went on to
another member. To be honest I don't think I should have been given the
lammy in any case. I currently wield Sinoche's Partisan and Trolloch's
Skien (10/25 5pois, procs a poison based whirl type stun, off hand only).
The Lamentation is equal to the Partisan, and worth 2-3x as much. And
certainly worth more than an off hand weapon for a class that doesnt melee
all the time and doesn't get double attack.

Getting warriors weapons should be a top priority of a guild. Warriors are
critical for many raids, they tend to live the longest and need to have
every oppurtunity to keep the mob taunted on them. Behind them fall in all
the other melees, then behind that gaggle bards.

Obviously everyone is entitled to their own opinion, but I don't understand
why bards get upset when weapons are awarded to other classes first...

Elfson
